intro: Squamellaria major, commonly known as the giant squamellaria, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of southern Africa, particularly in countries like South Africa and Zimbabwe. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of rare plants.
